they started their collaborations before Target pulled back in their DEI. Don’t blame the designers.
somehow has contracts they have to abide by or they can get sued.
a lot of the time the artists started this months and months in advance and there is no way to pull out now.

that could be true going forward but most of the stuff in target now was/has already been purchased a while ago already. Most likely before they knew about target's intentions- or so I'd like to think
 either way, if interest… See more
we can buy from the artists directly, without middle man fees in either direction
Samantha Masley target does not support their employees/patrons — I do not support them.
Without DEI, this seems empty…as is my Target cart…we’re obviously not alone in taking a break from shopping there because money talks. See you when equality is back and cowering to clowns is done
exactly - well said!
Equality starts when veterans get a month not a day
Veterans and Military month is literally November.

Military Appreciation month is May 
 Veterans Appreciation is both May and November (like you said haha)
put stuff in your cart and don’t check out. Hurts their conversion.
bet
I currently have five $20k TVS sitting in my Target cart. Abandoned, baby!
will do.
Is this true? If so, I'm off to fill my cart! Which I have not done since they announced they're getting rid of DEI.
exactly.
Nope. I’ll buy it directly from the designer thanks.

why don't you ask them. Call their corporate office Margaret.

F? Fueher?
I no longer shop at Target. Removing the DEI policies means there are better places to shop.

Nice try Target. Can’t rehabilitate yourself. I went to my local Target Friday and saw Black History was not front and center as it was last year. Much less merchandise. I didn’t buy anything. And I won’t buy anything. Will visit businesses’ websites to purchase.

The problem is that these black artists are going to suffer because nobody will buy their items since it's in Target. I can't tell anybody what to do but if you want to support them just buy black owned products and that's all.

I'm mayo brigade myself but I look forward to the journals and notebooks each year because the designs are so unique and eye-catching compared to the tired ones they sell the rest of the year. I'm so torn.
Go buy them!!!
How are the artists gonna suffer??? Target already paid them for all the product that is in their stores... It not on consignment...

so did you write each contract personally? Tabitha Brown is a bigger name at Target and said she would suffer if people didn't buy her products and she still has a year left on her contract. There's a lot of things you and I don't know … See more
can we look her up and buy direct.

Corect... And with Target doing this it will lead to more exposure for these artists... Has nothing to to with the original post saying the artists will suffer because no o e will buy their 1 time deal of these items that Target will… See more

Jessica M. RaifordTabitha doesn't have her full collection online just her hair care everything else is with target. I'm pretty sure there's a clause in her contract. This is why I said we don't know what happens behind the scenes. People think they kn… See more
the sellers need to sell with others beside just Target.
sorry that is incorrect. They are paid off what is sold.
Just bought a bunch of Tabitha stuff and a bag from this months drop after she said she would feel the difference.
we need their names so we can support them directly

- Correct! There are 30+ black-owned brands who are asking us to buy from Target AND directly from their websites. They need our continued support, otherwise Target will divest, and their products will suffer.
buy from their websites.
i will buy directly from the artist. Target will not get a dime from me..
from what I’ve read you can buy from the artists directly instead of buying through target as the middle man!
you can buy from them directly.
buy directly from them.

yes this is what people don’t understand. And with them removing DEI and these artist sales go down they will be removed and will be much harder to ever get back on the shelves. I don’t plan on going in Target buying Iike I normally would … See more
shop directly to the artist. And sometimes we have to suffer a little to get what we want.
Target has already paid them. They need to offload the inventory now.
that's what I did last week. Only purchased black owned
online direct..

I just found out that my local co-op and Costco carry everything I used to buy at Target. I’ll be supporting businesses who don’t walk back their DEI commitments. All of these black businesses can also be supported directly.
Nice try, Target, but I’m not buying it. Or anything else at your store.
No way you can put this out after stopping DEI. You can’t pretend you care now. I’m done with you now. Was a very long time committed customer. No more.
I'm with everyone else here- support these businesses directly and not through target
Very bold of you to advertise and promote this when you just ditched your DEI initiatives.

I have a 3 foot tall Bullseye pup plushie. That tells you how much I’ve loved Target over the years. There’s a Target within walking distance of me, but I’ll be driving to Costco to load up this week.
It’s giving… “whoops, we already have all this inventory and still need to move it.” We see you, Target.
This was definitely filmed prior to the removal of DEI

you removed DEI we won’t buy anything from your stores or online.
after reading all the comments I’ll be there this weekend to purchase something I really don’t need just to support you now !!
no you won't.
seriously, nothing tells a customer fu like hypocritical bullshite.

they are still scaling back their DEI…….however their seasonal campaigns and merchandise are planned months in advance. They are likely going to see far less sales than normal on their Black History month merch, but if they totally scrapped… See more
Your done!!!!! We won't support you
But I thought DEI was no longer valid or a core value. TOO LATE FOR THIS COLLECTION.

So disappointed in the lack of spine Target has when it came to keeping DEI policies in place. I was a proud shopper.

Nope. I’ve sworn off Target after they caved under the

"If you stand for nothing, Burr, what'll you fall for?"

Interesting timing 
, shame on you Target .
Taking my money to Costco - shouldn’t have rolled back DEI at the drop of a hat. Byeeeee!
Ha!! Sorry not sorry Target

I'm confused, is DEI for protective measures? So nobody at higher levels can discriminate? To keep things level across the board? What if companies simply had a good sense of humanity and just didn't discriminate or would that be asking too much - for … See more
Target was my favorite store… I cannot believe you would even post this after what you’ve done. Shame on you!
Target was entertainment for me, coffee, shopping, loved it… No more… Going to Costco…
Sorry, Target. Too late now. Especially since you have this collection in the back at some stores. I’ll be shopping small business from now on.

The timing for this post is bad , a little too late for all of this! Here for the comments 
 But fr let’s support the businesses that had this set up before they ditched their DEI programs.
Bye… just learned about your DEI rollback… today’s purchase was my last.
This post is so incredibly tone deaf. Do you think we aren’t paying attention?! Fix this Target. Make it right.
So #Target removes #DEI from its values and still wants customers to spend money on a #BlackHistoryMonth collection? Stand up and do the right thing.
DEI had nothing to do with how much a company “values” customers
only the amount they bring in!
but it does for employees. Big concern.
it actually does.
Of course they value those who spend money. The question is- Do they value those who work for them? If they don’t value who works for them, they don’t actually value people, they value $.
actually yes they do!
maybe you should look up all the programs involved in DEI and fix your statement!
of course it does. It influences what products they sell, who they hire to reflect the customers they serve, and uplifts the community when they give veterans, women, the elderly, or disabled a job
did you seriously respond with THAT comment, it absolutely DOES!!!
right!!
they did. You should join them.
I know, right ...
no one needs DEI
these ads were probably filmed before they announced that. They use the ads anyway because they can play both sides.
They can surely try and when we can spread awareness.
yeah, wondered about that...
it's just marketing to them...always was...
you do realize this is a corporation and they care about money and not about their shoppers.
And that makes it better how?
it doesn't. I just think it is funny how people flocked to Target when the hot groups were being marketed to and now they've been dropped. It is all fake.
ask Costco if they can care about both?
make it make sense
A day late, dollar short Target. Nice try though!
there shouldn’t be DEI!!!!
right
Nope. Can’t roll back your DEI and then be all “but we carry black-owned businesses clothing”.
exactly!
exactly.
why can’t they?
because what they are doing is DEI even though they aren’t doing that anymore

Friend, unfortunately, that is not the case. 
 A company carrying products for sale from POC vendors/ business is no where near a DEI policy/ initiative. It just isn’t the same thing. But There’s hope for grow and change, right?

Well they can. I and everyone else will make a determination whether to spend money there. I typically dont support big companies that dont aligh with my moral believes. Everyone can decide on their own what to do

good because we won’t be there next year with them until they stop this misinformation about DEI and admit this is an attack on black Americans!
don’t shop there.
this has been a thing for years. Nothing new. I love the black history apparel

same!
SAME!!

if you don’t know the answer to that question…

what does the D stand for?
Your typical grades in high school?

guess they want to move the merchandise they already had.

Target reworded their DEI program. They absorbed it into preexisting facets of the company. They never said they were done with holding the DEI principles in their business practices. People are upset over nothing.
People don't read company policies, so they assume.
that’s what I thought.
Sounds like “double speak” to me. Reworded? No. They backed down.

when did they say that? I haven’t seen anything like that

we have a whole section and always have

No ma’am, if you have gift cards, they already got the money. Go use them to buy products from a minority-owned brand. Or, buy diapers and donate them. They got the money, take the product, or they win twice.
they already made their money when the gift card was bought. Use them. You’re just punishing yourself if you don’t.
agree with the others—if it’s specifically a Target gift card, do make sure you use it; otherwise, they just got your money without having to make good
